0.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The lush forest opens up to a rugged and rocky valley to the north.  The
barren plain of Pharsica lie to the south.  The forest is full of life.
Creatures run and frolic all throughout the woods.  The gentle sounds of
their paws and hooves running through the fallen underbrush echoes from tree
to tree.

1.name: A Valley of Rocks
desc: "   The valley is covered in rocks of all shapes and sizes that have fallen
from the mountains lying to the east and west.  Any semblance of life that
was once here has been crushed and buried underneath the rocky landscape.
A lush forest of green lies directly to the south.  The shadows of animals
running and playing in the forest dart in and out of the woodland trees.

2.name: A Valley of Rocks
desc: "   The valley is covered in rocks of all shapes and sizes that have fallen
from the towering mountain to the east.  The valley of Pharsica stretches
out as far as the eyes can see to the northwest.  A large mountain range to
the far west blocks further travel in that direction.  It looks like the
mountains can be climbed up at certain points.  The trees growing in the
lush forest to the south grow too tightly together to explore in that
direction.

3.name: A Valley of Rocks
desc: "   The valley is covered in rocks of all shapes and sizes that have fallen
from the towering mountain to the west.  The valley of Pharsica stretches
out as far as the eyes can see to the north.  A large mountain range to
the far east blocks further travel in that direction.  It looks like the
mountains can be climbed up at certain points.  The trees growing in the
lush forest to the south grow too tightly together to explore in that
direction.

4.name: A Valley of Rocks
desc: "   The valley is covered in rocks of all shapes and sizes that have fallen
from the mountains to the east.  Any semblance of life that once lived and
grew here has been crushed and buried underneath the rocky rubble.  The
valley of Pharsica stretches out as far as the eyes can see to the north.
A large mountain range to the far west grows up to meet the heavens.  A
lush green forest grows at the end of the valley to the far south.  The
shadows of the woodland creatures running through the woods can barely
be seen from here.

5.name: A Valley of Rocks
desc: "   The valley is covered in rocks of all shapes and sizes that have fallen
down from the mountains to the east and west.  The mountains completely
seal off the valley to the east and west, creating a long rocky tunnel to
the north and south.  The only way out would seem to fly up into the skies
themselves.  A line of green trees can be seen growing to the far southeast.

The valley of Pharsica stretches out as far as the eyes can see to the north.
A large mountain range to the far east grows up and meets the heavens.  It
looks like the mountains can be climbed up at certain points.

be seen in the distance to the south.

desc: "   The valley is covered in rocks of all shapes and sizes that have fallen
down from the mountains to the east and west.  A small fortification has
been built into the side of the mountain here.  The color and structure of
the tower make it impossible to see from a distance.  It looks very well
protected and should probably not be explored.  You can see guards staring
at you from within the mountain tower's walls.  The valley of Pharsica
stretches out all the way to another mountain range to the far east.

47.name: A Valley of Rocks
desc: "   The valley is covered in rocks of all shapes and sizes that have fallen
down from the mountains to the east.  Any semblance of life that once
lived and grew here has been crushed and buried beneath the rocky rubble.
A lush green forest grows and thrives to the north.  You can see the
movement and shadows running through the trees.  However, something is
quiet and almost ominous about this part of Pharsica.  The shadows
appear to forebode something terrible and waiting.  The valley of Pharsica
stretches out as far as the eyes can see to the southwest.

49.name: A Valley of Rocks
desc: "   The valley is covered in rocks of all shapes and sizes that have fallen
down from the surrounding mountains.  The mountain directly to the north
is clearly the largest of the range so far, it climbs up way into the clouds.
The towering mountains completely seal off the rocky valley to the west and
east, creating a long rock covered tunnel to the south.  Any semblance of
life that once lived and grew here has been crushed and buried beneath the
rocky rubble.  Looking closely at the mountain range to the far west, it
looks like you may be able to climb up there.

51.name: A Valley of Rocks
desc: "   The valley is covered in rocks of all shapes and sizes that have fallen
down from the surrounding mountains.  The mountain directly to the north
is clearly the largest along the range so far.  It climbs all the way into
the clouds.  The valley seems to have ended in an alcove between the
mountains.  It looks like the mountain may be able to be climbed from here.
However, the rocks look unsteady and you do not want to find out what it
is like to be buried beneath a boulder in the valley below you.  It is
probably best to turn around and go back into the valley of rocks.

or up the rocky mountain to the east.  You better be careful climbing up
the mountain of you could end up buried underneath the next falling
boulder.

down from the mountain to the west.  The valley seems to have ended in an

Any semblance of life that once lived and grew in the valley has been

it may be able to be climbed up from here, but you may wind up like
whatever has been crushed and buried underneath the rubble of the valley.

54.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The light trickles down through the tree tops and onto the heavy underbrush
of the forest floor.  The forest is strangely devoid of life, but you have
the feeling that someone or something is watching you.  Shadows pass in and
out of the trees surrounding you.  A large mountain rises up and through
the lush green trees to the east.  Peering through the trees to the south,
you can see the vase and rocky valley of Pharsica.

the trees surrounding you.  A large mountain rises up and through the lush
green trees to the west.  Peering through the trees to the south, you can
see the vast and rocky valley of Pharsica.

of the forest floor.  An eerie silence stifles this part of the forest.  The
forest is strangely devoid of life, but you have the feeling that someone or
something is watching you.  Shadows pass in and out of the trees surrounding
you.  There is definitely something else in this forest besides you.

70.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The trees in this section are completely torn apart and uprooted.  It
looks like something is still here causing huge amounts of damage.  You
cannot get a good look at it, but can see the outline of something massive.
As quickly as the faint image appears it disappears.  Complete silence
fills the area, until a snort of warm air begins to breath down your neck.
This is probably a good time to run.

83.name: A Path Around the Mountain
desc: "   The mountain path is wide but rugged.  The rocks look very unstable, as
though they could give out at any moment.  It is an awfully long way to
the top of the mountain.  What could be up there?  The path around the
mountain continues up.  The rocky valley between the mountains stretches
out to the west.

84.name: A Path Around the Mountain
desc: "   The mountain path is wide but rugged.  The rocks look very unstable, as
though they could give out at any moment.  It is an awfully long way to
the top of the mountain.  What could be up there?  Looking out over the
edge of the mountain, to the south you can see what appears to be the
green tree tops of the forests of Pharsica and to the west you can see
the rocky valley between the mountains.  The path around the mountain
continues up and down.

128.name: A Sturdy Rope Bridge
desc: "   The sturdy bridge hangs from ropes attached to the mountain to the north.

178.name: A Trail Around the Mountain
desc: "   The weather is becoming much more treacherous.  The winds bite and
scratch across your face as they whip around the mountain side.  The trail
around the mountain is narrow and well worn.  This path has obviously been
very well traveled.  This mountain is the tallest in all of Pharsica.  The
top of the mountain looks close, maybe another mile or so.  Looking out
over the mountain's edge, to the south you can see two mountain ranges
falling in the distance with a valley in between them.  The winds blowing
across the mountain's face are getting even stronger, even as the temperature
begins to drop as the elevation increases.  They nearly blow you off of the
trail at certain points.  The trail around the mountain continues up and
to the west.

186.name: A Trail Around the Mountain
desc: "   The weather is becoming much more treacherous.  The winds bite and

187.name: A Trail Around the Mountain

189.name: A Trail Around the Mountain
desc: "   The temperatures at this height chill you to the bone.  The weather is
becoming even more terrible.  The winds bite and scratch across your face
as they whip around the mountain side.  The trail around the mountain is
starting to get covered in flakes of snow falling from further up the
mighty peak.  The top of the mountain looks close, just a little further
along the trail.  The winds blowing across the mountain's face are getting
even stronger, even as the temperature continues to drop as the elevation
increases.  They nearly blow you off the trail at certain points.  No
one could survive a fall into the ocean from this height.  The trail
around the mountain continues up and to the north.

190.name: A Trail Around the Mountain
desc: "   The temperatures at this height chill you to the bone.  The weather is
becoming even more terrible.  The winds bite and scratch across your face
as they whip around the mountain side.  The trail around the mountain is
starting to get covered in flakes of snow falling from further up the

increases.  They nearly blow you off the trail at certain points.  No
one could survive a fall into the ocean from this height.  The trail
around the mountain continues down and to the east.

191.name: A Trail Around the Mountain
desc: "   The temperatures at this height chill you to the bone.  Pieces of your
armor begin to freeze and crack, falling to the ground in pieces.  The
snowy winds bite and scratch across your face as they whip around the
mountain side.  The snow covering the mountain trail is getting deeper
the further you climb up the mountain.  The mountain's peak appears to
be close, just a little further up the mountain side.  The winds blowing
across the mountain's face are getting even stronger, even as the
temperature continues to drop as the elevation increases.  They nearly
blow you off the trail at certain points.  It would certainly be a long
way down from here.  The trail around the mountain continues up and to
the west.

192.name: A Trail Around the Mountain
desc: "   The temperatures at this height chill you to the bone.  Pieces of your
armor begin to freeze and crack, falling to the ground in pieces.  The
snowy winds bite and scratch across your face as they whip around the
mountain side.  The snow covering the mountain trail is getting deeper
the further you climb down the mountain.  The mountain's peak appears to
be close, just a little further down the mountain side.  The winds blowing
across the mountain's face are getting even stronger, even as the
temperature continues to drop as the elevation increases.  They nearly
blow you off the trail at certain points.  It would certainly be a long
way down from here.  The trail around the mountain continues down and to
the east.

193.name: A Trail Around the Mountain
desc: "   The temperatures at this height chill you to the bone.  Pieces of your
armor begin to freeze and crack, falling to the ground in pieces.  The
snowy winds bite and scratch across your face as they whip around the
mountain side.  The snow covering the mountain trail is getting deeper
the further you climb up the mountain.  The mountain's peak appears to
be close, just a little further up the mountain side.  The winds blowing
across the mountain's face are getting even stronger, even as the
temperature continues to drop as the elevation increases.  They nearly
blow you off the trail at certain points.  It would certainly be a long
way down from here.  The trail around the mountain continues up and to
the west.

194.name: A Trail Around the Mountain
desc: "   The mountain side is becoming truly unbearable.  The temperatures at
this height chill you to the bone.  Pieces of your armor begin to freeze and
crack, falling to the ground in pieces.  The snowy winds bite and scratch
across your face as they whip around the mountain side.  The rocky texture
of the mountain is now frozen and almost impossible to get a good hand hold
in.  Falling off the mountain at this point is probably a forgone conclusion.
The mountain's peak appears to be close, just a couple feet further.  A
green luster emanates from the top of the mountain.  What could be up there?
The trail around the mountain continues up and down.

195.name: The Top of the Mountain
desc: "   A rune covered door sits at the top of the snow covered mountain.  Large
drafts of snow pour through the door with enough power to throw you back
down the mountain side.  The door pulses with a green luster that emanates
throughout the mountain top.  The door is just begging to be touched.
Where does it go and where is all this snow coming from?  A small trail
along the mountain leads down.

196.name: Inside a Tent
desc: "   The inside of the tent is very basic.  There are a few sleeping bags
and some camping equipment scatted along the ground.  A lone lantern
lights up the insides of the tent.  Some camping supplies have been stored
towards the back of the tent.  The only way out appears to be through
the tentflap at the front of the tent.

197.name: A Cave of Skulls
desc: "   The skulls of the dead litter the ground and hang from the ceiling of the
cave like trophies.  There are several dismembered and decomposing bodies
rotting all over the cavern floor.  A small whimper sniffles from the back
of the cave.  It is difficult to see what is back there in the darkness
of the cave.  Suddenly, a large shadow moves in front of you and opens
its blood-shot ruby red eyes to greet you.

198.name: Lair of the Shadow Dragon
desc: "   The cave is not very large considering the size of the shadow dragon.
It is dank and warm, almost unnaturally warm.  There is a small nest of
twigs and rocks towards the back of the cave.  Some movement began near
the nest as soon as you entered the cave.  It is probably not a good idea
to get too close if they are anything like their mother.  There does not
appear to be any clear way out of the cave.
